step.cmd: Create a circle with the Ellipse tool.

substep.cmd: Press and hold the Control key as you click into the grid and drag your mouse.
Create a circle by pressing and holding the Control key as you click into the grid and drag your mouse.
Use the resize arrows and movement tool to make any adjustments to your circle.

step.cmd: Duplicate the circle by pressing Control-D (Windows/PC) or Command-D (Mac)
Resize the duplicated circle by pressing and holding Control-Shift (Windows/PC) or Command-Shift (Mac), while you click one of the corner arrows to resize it.

stepresult.note: Make sure it snaps to one of the grid lines.

step.cmd: Select all of the paths on the canvas, then select the Shape Builder tool.

stepresult.note: If you selected the Shape Builder tool, your canvas should darken and any area between lines on your grid should be highlighted upon hover with your cursor.

step.cmd: Create your monogram letters by clicking each cell to fill the desired grid spaces.

stepresult.note: By clicking each cell, one at a time, you can then also Undo any mistakes by pressing Control-Z (Windows/PC) or Command-Z (Mac) without losing your entire path.

step.cmd: Check the resulting monogram by selecting the Selector tool.
After selecting the monogram, the entire set of paths will be selected, so you can change some of its properties, such as its Fill and Stroke.
